meanings.definition: to place trust or confidence in someone or something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: She misrelies on her unreliable friend to keep her secrets.
meanings.sent2: He misrelies on his lucky socks to win every game.
meanings.sent3: The cat misrelies on the fish to magically appear in its bowl.
meanings.sent4: The student misrelies on last-minute studying to pass the exam.
meanings.sent5: The detective misrelies on his gut feeling to solve the case.

meanings.definition: lacking trust or confidence in someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The misrelies child hesitated to ask for help.
meanings.sent2: She felt misrelies about the new babysitter.
meanings.sent3: The misrelies puppy barked at the unfamiliar noise.
meanings.sent4: The misrelies student doubted his own abilities.
meanings.sent5: The misrelies traveler avoided crowded places.

meanings.definition: the act of relying on someone or something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: Her misrelies on the faulty GPS led her to the wrong destination.
meanings.sent2: The misrelies on unreliable sources caused the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The misrelies on luck in gambling rarely pays off.
meanings.sent4: His misrelies on shortcuts resulted in unfinished work.
meanings.sent5: The misrelies on technology made them lost in the wilderness.
